value.title: DAX Fridays! #85: Difference between dates in the same column
value.excerpt: Do you know how to calculate the difference between dates when both are in the same column?  One example of when this is needed is when you are working with subscription based services. If you want to calculate how many dates go between users changing subscriptions, this DAX measure will help you.  To

value.title: DAX Fridays! #95: Binning, Frequency and relative frequency | Data profiler
value.excerpt: This is the first of a series of videos about data profiling and descriptive statistics. In today's video, I will show you how to bin data,  calculate the frequency and relative frequency using DAX.  What you think about the series? let me know in the comment box. value.title: DAX Fridays! #96: MEDIAN, AVERAGE, MEAN, MODE | The Bill Gates Effect
value.excerpt: In part 2 of the data profiling series, we are going to talk about MEAN, AVERAGE, MODE AND MEDIAN and try to explain them with a story, what I call the Bill Gates Effect.  Main topics?  Is average a good measure ? When is average a bad metric to use? Calculate median Calculate mode.  Here is the website

value.title: DAX Fridays! #98: NORM.DIST | Predicting Kevin Durant Scores

value.title: Age Banding in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function   Relationship Based on Between
value.excerpt: One of the most common types of banding or binning is banding based on a range. Let's say, for example,  you want to have a group of customers based on their age group. The age group banding can be created in Power Query at the data transformation stage. It can be created using the Grouping and Binning

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX

value.title: Creating Calendar Table in Power BI using DAX Functions
